Notes: Very late season ice. This bear remains on ice until the bonepile appears. Bear starts moving eastward on 9/13, same day as the first harvest on Cross Island.
Undecided bear. Goes back out to sparse, undetectable ice.  Chunk is visible 08/16 near where bear appears to 'swim' back out into the ocean.
Bear lands in August but goes straight back out to ice until September. Listed as 'undecided'? Appears to be motivated by the bonepile. See email with TA and DD
Last point bear is on ice. Appears to swim north before turning south and swimming basically straight to land (straight south)
Southward movement begins much earlier ~7/31. See notes for undecided bears.
Last point ice detected. Bear swims west, does a curly-q (looking for ice?), then swims nearly directly south

No ice detected but presumably bear is on very sparse ice based on movement patterns. Confirmed on MODIS that chunks of ice exist that are not detected by MASIE. 8/13 is a clear day close to 8/15 and we can see the chunks.
Departure point 3.6 km from edge of pack ice, presumably bear is on thin ice. Points disappear after this suggesting bear is swimming.
Bear does not appear to swim. Likely walks along the edge of the pack ice (on undetectable ice) until goes ashore. Goes back out to ice for a day before settling on land.
Spends summer on ice - only comes to shore after ice reforms over shelf (?)

Sparse ice visible in area 7/17 on MASIE. Visualization on MODIS indicates sparse ice (separated from pack ice) is still in area until 7/24. Southward turn (swim) on 7/25 seems to correspond with melt in that region.
Looks like bear uses ice until the last minute.
Very sparse ice visible in MODIS
Takes off not too far from edge of detectable pack ice - signal lost until arrival on land
Double-check departure with what was previosly called. Subjective because signal is not lost; clear directional movement that ends on land; appears to begin at this point
Cannot see ice in MODIS; see 20525. Follows very similar (parallel) path but slightly south.
Extremely tiny chunks of ice visible in MODIS.
Similar path to others in 2014. Hmm. Signal is lost and then bear appears on land.
